content.label: It looks nice but is frustrating to play. Some of the scenarios are pretty impossible to get the tree to go around and I regret wasting $4 on this waste of time.

I downloaded this little gem when I was stressed and wanted something peaceful to do on my phone.

This is it.

I found myself audibly sighing, smiling, and snapping screenshots of the beautiful trees I‚Äôd helped flower.

Only downside is I couldn‚Äôt get the sound working :/ - dev help?

Yes it is VERY simple to play but you may find yourself trying to decipher some of the colors and effects of some of the levels. It took me 2 days to make it through the game but now I'm going back for blue flowers and to try to reach the sun etc. 

I would love to see some instructions added. Maybe the option to turn on or off a point system. I like the non complicated nature of it but I don't think it would be diminished with clarification and points. Maybe a second game with different challenges? Would definitely buy a second version guys! If you build it, I will come!

Honestly a great game. This is one of the few games I‚Äôve come across where the sound effects and background music don‚Äôt drive me crazy. There aren‚Äôt enough levels for a $4 game. I completed them all in 2 hours.
Similar feel to world of goo yet unique little short however going back and making the best trees and going for bonuses keeps you going

this game is very very pretty, fun, and calming to play. my only gripe is that its also very short. the only thing i could think of to make the game even more enjoyable is an 'endless mode' kind of thing, maybe where you can just grow your tree infinitely, or maybe with randomized obstacles ? i have already finished the game and collected all the secret flowers in just under one day, and for a 4 dollar app i would hope for more gameplay.

title.label: Liked it until the rushed levels

content.label: This is an absolutely great app and I like how it's a peaceful game. But once you get to a certain level there's challenges that make you rushed and I think that kind of ruins the game üòï

so i‚Äôm totally keen on this app, but the first day i got it, i finished all the levels. i‚Äôm just confused as to why there‚Äôs such a limited amount of levels??? can we get more!!!??? i paid 4$ for one day of playing
This app is awesome! It‚Äôs 3.99 though, and there are under 30 levels. It lasted me under a day

Boring and repetitive. At later levels it just becomes annoying af since you can‚Äôt do anything to the oh-such-delicate trees - prune too much then you don‚Äôt get enough flowers, can‚Äôt do this can‚Äôt do that.

Beautiful concept at first, but got more and more depressing as it went on. I'm a gardener, so the thought of a poor tree struggling to survive amid industrialization and pollution was sad. I was hoping for an uplifting and peaceful game, not reminders of what we're doing to our planet. Suggestion: make another game like this but with the tree in nature.
Very creative game, really enjoyed it for the couple hours it took to win. Should be way more levels for the price.
I want the transition effect of the game to be smoother and more care about the design of the game interface

title.label: I mean it‚Äôs ok if your into that sort of thing

content.label: It‚Äôs DEFINITELY not worth the money but it‚Äôs kinda cool pretty relaxing but not that fun after a couple levels. But whatever that‚Äôs just me
I finished all the levels in 5 or so hours. I expected a lot more considering I had to pay 3.99 for the game and it was editors choice.
I suggest that you add more levels or make a level creator to late people get creative with the way the game works!

All I can say is... wow. This game is so much more than just about cutting branches and growing flowers or whatever. It is a story; a story about life, how no matter what obstacle life encounters, it will find a way to survive and continue. And I have never felt so emotionally impacted by a game in my life, besides Shadow of the Colossus. For example, sometimes, I complete a level while the ‚Äúred‚Äù stuff, whatever it is, is infecting my tree, and, even though I completed the level, I feel a pang of sadness as I know that that tree will spend the rest of its days as a red husk, unable to produce flowers or do anything other than sit there as a testimony to the red infection. I have never felt like this towards a game, ever; this is a game about GROWING TREES, for Pete‚Äôs sake. And yet it managed to pull on my heartstrings as though I could feel everything the trees felt in the game. Easy five stars, amazing game.

this game is cool. but then you try to zoom in on a part of the tree and it pulls you away... I finished the whole thing in less than a week. to the general public, don't waste your money, and to the creator, ADD MORE LEVELS!!

name.label: foo loves to party and stuff

content.label: not only was this app therapeutic, but it was something i have never seen before.

I just bought this. I rated the preview. I know it's premature but being a rose gardener as a profession, it is a spiritual experience. I had to be a part of this virtual Prune. It is amazing to construe roses but a trim, pluck & prune. Sk√∂l
Entertaining for a couple hours, all levels completed fairly quickly :(
Great idea and really beautiful game, but it quickly becomes too difficult to be enjoyable.
I wasted my money.
Prune is an enjoyable game with few levels and low replay value.  I played the game off and on for four days before completing it.  Aside from being a little short, it‚Äôs a pleasant game.

I absolutely adore everything about your game‚Äî the music and sound effects are so calming and add a tangibility to all the on screen actions. The art design is easily my favorite part‚Äî the use of color as a guide throughout the different levels is really clever. Keeping the game mechanics straightforward helped me feel engaged with the game while still being able to actively enjoy the unique and beautiful world you created. Two of my all time favorite console games are Flower and Journey, and you have managed to evoke the sense of calm and focus I get with those games. I have not encountered a mobile game I have enjoyed as much as yours. I hope you keep making games, and I will definitely keep an eye out for them in the future! Thank you for your game!

title.label: The timed levels ruin the meditative aspect

content.label: I love this app. It's beautifully designed, and generally a pleasure to play. I initially found it very relaxing, but the levels at which the plant burns, introducing a time constraint ruin that aspect. Other levels are challenging without being rushed, which is much more in keeping with the pleasure of the game.
Prune is by far the greatest game I‚Äôve played this year. It‚Äôs everything I love. I recommend Prune for everyone between 10-100. Most puzzles are straightforward but Prune goes so very deep.

I NEVER write reviews for apps, but this game is something special. The visuals, the music, everything about this game is amazing. I‚Äôm not sure if ‚Äòspoilers‚Äô are a thing in a metaphor-based story such as Prune‚Äôs, but just in case, I‚Äôll just say that the ending is so deeply emotional considering this is a game about TRIMMING TREES. Anyway, great game, 100% worth it.
Very nice game

...it's either way too glitchy or way too confusing, I can't tell which. Allow me to explain:

I find the layout of the levels extremely confusing. It's just dots and some of them are clear and others are filled in? Are the clear ones incomplete? Does it even mean anything? Who knows! Not me.

I've played a couple times and had it suddenly reset to the beginning without warning. I have no idea if this means I won the game, or if it was a glitch. What's the deal? Who knows! Not me!

If that IS the end of the game, that's an alarmingly short number of levels for a game you pay for. Wish it kept going!

Anyway basically I'm just hella confused about what levels I have or have not played and whether or not I've beat the game, or if it's glitching out on me. Will I ever find out? Who knows! Not me!

Tldr: extremely fun with great game play but super confusing interface when switching between levels.

Title describes the game really. When I got to the end, I had a feeling I knew what was gonna happen & when it happened it was even better and such a full circle I felt. I just thought, "Whoaaaaa." I felt so proud. I learned so much from this game. You'll know what I mean when you play it, which I recommend you do. 
I've played it only once through but in the future perhaps I'll play again & take my time to try pruning differently so I can achieve some neat looking trees. I felt like the first time I was still learning and ended chopping the branches off into stubs, desperately trying to save my tree. 
Anyway play it. It's 3.99 but like my bf said, you're paying for an experience. And a great experience it was!
What a lovely game.  Challenging yet relaxing.  Creative and fun.  Great replay value.  Perfect for an iPhone.  Brilliant game design.  Deeply engaging though simple to learn.  Bravo!

I especially like this app because the creative challenge with the background music an added plus!  The example video is only a taste. This is a level earning challenge that is not as simple as you would think. I originally bought it for brain stimulation. Success!  It's awesome, relaxing and challenging all together. I've paid for TWO apps and this one by far, is worth it!

I do not know where to begin. So I will just say that this game is an absolute blessing. I can go on and on about this game, but my main focus is those white trees. I have continued to unlock these secrets within the game and I'm stuck on that white tree I saw. It amazed me, brought me to realization that this game is more then just cutting branches off of a tree, it's furthering what the eye can't see. Developer, aid me in my efforts to conquer this game. Thank you.
It's needs to be updated because I would like to have more levels
My only complaint is that I want more! Any chance we could get a "free play" option so we can maintain a tree in a non-competitive/non-goal-oriented setting?

title.label: Beautiful but not nearly long enough

content.label: This game is honestly one of the most visually appealing games I've played across all platforms and art styles. However, I blew through this game in less than a week and I really just wish it was longer for the amount one paid to even try it.
I love this game but not enough levels for five dollars
The game was vary fun I loved it but it was to short.   I finished it in two day I really wish it had more levels.
Worth it though doesn't have high replay ability

The Music, the design, everything about this game was so amazing that I can't stop thinking about it. I also see a meaning in it: as I progressed, the game got more difficult but also, the themes became more industrialized and the trees became further down underground; it became more difficult for them to reach the light and people probably forgot about nature. In the last level, everything was shaking and the world was overtaken with red (nuclear holocaust of the human race?) and then everything was dead. And there was a tree, showing that life still continues. I found it to be an incredibly strong metaphor that induced such a strong emotional, mental, and even spiritual reaction from me.

title.label: Absolutely Love This Game, But, Could Use a Few Improvements

content.label:
I just started playing this game about a week ago and love it. It looks so simple but there's so much more than what it looks like.
There's a few things though that I feel could make the game even better and address a couple of questions and issues. I was surprised to find out there was a "ceiling" and you can only go so far up. It would be great if it was indefinite to see how far you can actually go. 
I was also wondering what the different color "moons" or "suns" were, are they something you want to branch out as much as possible to? And the different colored diamonds in the sky. I noticed occasionally when there's a blue diamond a blue flower will bloom then just as quick disappear. 
I seem to notice when cutting branches the game doesn't respond to my swipe and sometimes it takes two or three times before it cuts.
Lastly, are white branches a good thing? They seem to be a random thing. It would be great if these things could be explained in the opening of the game. Otherwise, I think it's a great game!

Was a good concept with a lot of potential. I wouldn't say it is $5 worth of game but if you can get it on a sale go for it. Definitely wasn't as fun or satisfying as i was lead on to believe. Would rather have my money back

I love this game, it's very pretty and a super cool idea, I could play it for a very long time. Except the problem is there are only 5 'groups' with about 12 levels in each and once you finish those there's nothing else to do on the app. :/ Other than that though I love it.

At first, I didn't get this game. I am quite cautious about buying games, and at first I thought it was a total waste of money. BUT, in just 5 minutes, I was IN LOVE with this game. TOTALLY worth the price. ***note for authors, I expect more levels with higher difficulty***
recommend playing while listening to the interstellar soundtrack. the last level i didnt feel like i won because all of the blossoms didnt fully devolop before the game abruptly ended.
Beautifully made with ambiance and art that leaves the player wanting more!! Like me. It's mysterious and addicting! I'm looking forward to new levels.

title.label: oh, and in case you didn't know - this game/experience deserves the hype

content.label:
One of my all time favorite games...it's just so perfect in every way...the craft/art that went into this game/project by the dev and musician is one of the all-time greatest achievements in IOS gaming...imo, it changed every notion you could have about an iOS game, and the kind of game devs could make...this is like that masterpiece album that influenced a new generation of game developers with a strong visual presence, combining a timely thought provoking message and innovative gameplay. This is an essential for any iOS library. The score is unbelievably haunting, uplifting and beautiful at difference times within the game...the final 'level' or sequence can bring me to happy tears of joy.

Update: developer deserves praise for awesome customer support which is so refreshing to see...this guy can do it all, and seems like one of the nicest people....seriously, support this game if you are discovering for the first time
I feel like for the amount of money I paid that there should be more than 5 worlds. Other than that it's fun to try to grow your tree to enormous heights
Good game... just not $0.99 good. It could be a good free game.
